name: Mixed Bag 6 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Average [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the USA, the wood from what tree is most often used for smoking meats and curing hams?
questions.explanation:
Hickory.

	The hickory belongs to the walnut family. They are also valued for their tough hard wood.

13th.

	It was passed by both houses in the early part of 1865 and formally proclaimed in December of 1865.

questions.text: In 'Goodbye Mr. Chips' what is the occupation of the title character?
questions.explanation:
Schoolmaster.

	Robert Donat won an Oscar for playing that role.

questions.text: Where was 'Mary Hartman, Mary Hartman' set?
questions.explanation:
Fernwood.

	This was a late night soap opera from 1976-1977 produced by Norman Lear.

questions.text: Donald Duck has starred in over how many animated shorts?
questions.explanation:
150.

	According to a Disney article. He was also banned in one country because he didn't wear pants.

questions.text: Name the Kingfish's wife on the 'Amos and Andy Show.'
questions.explanation:
Sapphire.

	Between 1929 and 1931 the nation stopped dead in it's tracks and tuned in nightly to this 15 minute broadcast.

questions.text: What was the original name of Columbia University?
questions.explanation:
Kings College.

	Founded in 1754 it became Columbia University in 1912.

questions.text: Which of the following had a mother complex named after him?
questions.explanation:
Oedipus.

	Oedipus complex is a son's largely unconscious sexual attraction toward his mother along with a jealousy towards his father.

questions.text: Which is not a general division of history?

questions.explanation:
Hamlet.

	'Hamlet' was probably Shakespeare's most famous play.
